intro: Senecio phaenicochaetus, commonly known as the Cape snowflake, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is a perennial herb characterized by its hairy stems and striking white or pale blue flowers that resemble snowflakes. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is known for its showy inflorescences. Senecio phaenicochaetus is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens.
